item.title: DataGrip Is Now Free for Non-Commercial Use
item.description: We‚Äôre excited to announce a change in our licensing model that we believe will benefit the developer community ‚Äì DataGrip is now free for non-commercial use! With this change, DataGrip joins JetBrains RustRover, CLion, Rider, WebStorm, and RubyMine, which are already free for non-commercial use. Read on to learn more about the change and why [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/datagrip/2025/10/01/datagrip-is-now-free-for-non-commercial-use/

item.title: Better AI Depends on Better Data: We Need Your Help
item.description: TL;DR Over the past few years, AI has made remarkable progress, but it doesn‚Äôt always deliver what professional developers need. One key reason is that most models are trained on public datasets that don‚Äôt reflect the complex, real-world scenarios faced by professional developers every day. Without such real-world data, our AI tools will fall short. [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/blog/2025/09/30/detailed-data-sharing-for-better-ai/

item.title: Updates to TeamCity On-Premises Renewal Pricing
item.description: We‚Äôre committed to continuously improving TeamCity and providing high-quality support. To reflect that ongoing investment, we‚Äôre updating our renewal pricing and grace period policies, effective November 3, 2025. At the same time, we‚Äôre ensuring that all existing licenses purchased before November 3, 2025, will continue to benefit from the current renewal discounts. What‚Äôs changing? Next [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2025/09/updates-to-teamcity-on-premises-renewal-pricing/

item.title: Introducing Claude Agent in JetBrains IDEs
item.description: TL;DR: The new Claude Agent is now seamlessly integrated into JetBrains IDEs via the AI chat and included in the JetBrains AI subscription. No extra plugins, no extra subscriptions ‚Äì just advanced AI coding assistance built on Anthropic‚Äôs Agent SDK, which powers Claude Code, right inside your IDE. The new agent leverages Anthropic models, including [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/ai/2025/09/introducing-claude-agent-in-jetbrains-ides/

item.title: ‚ÄúI tried out JetBrains‚Äô code analysis tool Qodana‚Äù

item.title: How Java Open-Source Projects Use IntelliJ IDEA: Real-World Examples ‚Äì Part¬†2
item.description: In Part 1 of this series, we introduced some of the Java community‚Äôs most recognized open-source projects. Now, we‚Äôre back with more standouts: projects that speed up builds, strengthen testing, and simplify working with modern web stacks. item.title: Continuing Positive Impact: This Year‚Äôs AI4SE Interns in their New Roles at JetBrains
item.description: In our last post, we introduced the talented intern cohort from our AI for Software Engineering (AI4SE) research partnership with Delft University of Technology (TU Delft). In this post, we‚Äôre excited to spotlight the next chapter in their journey: their evolution from interns to full-time members of our tech team. item.title: Rider Roadmap: What to Expect From the Upcoming Updates and Releases
item.description: With Rider 2025.2 already out in the wild and the 2025.3 release cycle underway, we want to take a step back and give you a broader picture of where Rider is headed. This roadmap covers our plans for Rider 2025.3 and what you can expect from the minor updates included in the 2025.2 release line. [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/dotnet/2025/09/25/rider-rider-roadmap-2025-3/

item.title: Why Is Python So Popular in 2025?
item.description: While other programming languages come and go, Python has stood the test of time and firmly established itself as a top choice for developers of all levels, from beginners to seasoned professionals. Whether you‚Äôre working on intelligent systems or data-driven workflows, Python has a pivotal role to play in how your software is built, scaled, [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/pycharm/2025/09/why-is-python-so-popular/

item.title: The Kotlin AI Stack: Build AI Agents With Koog, Code Smarter With Junie, and More
item.description: AI is changing how we build software, and Kotlin is ready to meet that change by empowering developers to build AI-powered apps and by enhancing the developer experience through AI-based tools. This post explores both angles: the tools for developing AI-powered apps, both from JetBrains and from the community, and the ways Kotlin is evolving [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/kotlin/2025/09/the-kotlin-ai-stack-build-ai-agents-with-koog-code-smarter-with-junie-and-more/
